news24h.headline: Gold price builds on recovery from $3,248 trough, gains positive traction for second successive day
Gold fell to 3,336.11 USD/t.oz on July 2, 2025, down 0.07% from the previous day
Concerns about worsening US fiscal conditions drag USD to lowest level since February 2022
Trump steps up pressure campaign on Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell to lower borrowing costs
Heightened uncertainty over US President Donald Trump's tariff policies ahead of July 9 deadline
Markets pricing in roughly 74% probability of Fed rate cut as soon as September
Gold price takes a beating on ceasefire news - falls more than $50 an ounce
Gold climbs to over 3-week high as dollar weakens, geopolitical and trade tensions mount
RSI at 26.03 indicating oversold conditions with strong ADX at 60.55
Gold exchange-traded fund holdings increased by about 3.88 million ounces this year

keyFactors: Trump pressure on Fed for rate cuts
fedImpact: Markets are pricing in 74% probability of Fed rate cut by September as Trump pressures Powell to lower rates amid concerns about US fiscal conditions and persistent inflation risks

technicalView.keyLevels: Support at $3,300 round figure, resistance at $3,324-3,325 immediate hurdle with stronger resistance at $3,350

priceTarget: $3,350-3,400 upside target if momentum sustains above $3,324
currencyImpact: USD weakness to February 2022 lows providing strong tailwind for gold with inverse correlation maintaining at elevated levels
summary: Gold showing bullish recovery from oversold conditions with USD at multi-year lows and Fed rate cut expectations rising. Technical setup favors upside with RSI oversold and key resistance at $3,350. Risk-on from tariff uncertainties and Fed policy dovish pivot support higher prices.
